isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - REASSEMBLE - CLUTCH PACK (MEDIUM-DUTY)

note.para: The clutch pack can be installed in differential and gear support case with wheel differential assembled or disassembled. With differential assembled, proceed as follows:

step1.para: All Medium-duty CTD. Place differential assembly on a work bench (clutch pack mounting area up). Install ring gear on support case flange, aligning bolt holes with two temporarily-installed alignment bolts.

para.emph: Install Friction Plates and Driver (Permanent CTD Only).

note.para: Brush surface of each plate, as it is assembled, with a generous application of axle lube. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes.
To assemble friction plates, one of two procedures can be used: Install driver and plates individually (Step 3) or install driver and clutch pack as an assembly (Step 4).

para.emph: Install Friction Plates Individually (Permanent CTD Only) ( Figure 20)

step2.para: If removed, install snap ring on friction plate driver. Then, install driver assembly (snap ring down) in bore of support case, engaging teeth of differential side gear.
Place one external-splined plate in ring gear bore (engaging gear internal teeth). Brush plate with lube.
Place one internal-splined plate on driver splines and on top of the external-splined plate. Brush plate with lube.
Repeat this procedure until fourteen (14) friction plates (seven internal- splined and seven external-splined) are installed.
Install the last external-splined plate and pressure plate. Then install springs and cover (see Step 6).

para.emph: Install Driver and Clutch Pack as an Assembly (Permanent CTD Only) ( Figure 21)

figure.caption: Figure 21. Install Driver and Clutch Pack as an Assembly

step2.para: If removed, install snap ring on friction plate driver. Then, place driver (snap ring down) on work bench.
Place one external-splined plate on driver. Brush plate with lube.
Place one internal-splined plate on top of the external-splined plate. Brush plate with lube.
Repeat this procedure until fourteen (14) friction plates (seven external- splined and seven internal-splined) are installed. Then install the last external-splined plate and pressure plate.
Rotate external-splined plates as necessary to align the teeth. Then grasp the entire assembly by hand and install it in the ring gear.

note.para: As the assembly is installed, maneuver plates with external splines to align them with the ring gear teeth. Also make sure the driver engages teeth of the differential side gear.

step2.para: Install compression springs and case cover (Step 6).

para.emph: Install Friction Plates (Driver- Controlled and Seasonal CTD Only).

note.para: During friction plate (internal- splines) installation, align each plate as it is installed in ring gear, using the sliding clutch. If plates are not in alignment, it will be difficult to install sliding clutch, after clutch pack is assembled. Also, as each plate is installed, brush top of plate with a generous application of axle lube. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes. Proceed as follows:

step2.para: Place one external-splined plate in ring gear bore (engaging gear internal teeth). Brush plate with lube ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Place One External-Splined Plate in Ring Gear Bore

step2.para: Place one internal-splined plate on top of the external-splined plate and brush plate with lube. For alignment purposes, temporarily insert sliding clutch to engage side gear and plate splines. Remove clutch ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Temporarily Insert Sliding Clutch to Engage Side Gear and Plate Splines

step2.para: Repeat this procedure until fourteen (14) friction plates (seven internal-splined and seven external-splined) are installed.
Install the last external-splined plate and the pressure plate. And, again, insert sliding clutch to make sure internal-splined plates are in alignment. Install springs and case cover (see Step 6).

para.emph: Install Compression Springs and cover (All Types CTD).

step2.para: Install springs on pressure plate, positioning them in the smallest circle possible ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Position Springs in Smallest Circle Possible

step2.para: Place support case cover over springs and temporarily install two alignment bolts (heads up) ( Figure 25and Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Place Support Case Cover Over Springs
Figure 26. Temporarily Install Two Alignment Bolts

step2.para: Temporarily install two clamping nuts and bolts (nuts up). Remove alignment bolts. Alternately tighten clamping nuts until cover is in mounting position on ring gear ( Figure 27).

Install bolts and self-locking nuts that fasten cover to ring gear. Remove the temporarily-installed clamping nuts and bolts, and install the remaining cover bolts and self locking nuts ( Figure 28). Tighten nuts to 275 to 300 ft-lbs. (373 to 407 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Install Cover Bolts and Self Locking Nuts
